metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: 1 Short Title and Commencement.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (a) These Directions shall be called the Reserve Bank of India (Information Technology Governance, Risk, Controls and Assurance Practices) Directions, 2023.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (b) These Directions incorporate, consolidate and update the guidelines, instructions and circulars on IT Governance, Risk, Controls, Assurance Practices and Business Continuity/ Disaster Recovery Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: The list of circulars repealed is given in Chapter VII of this Master Direction.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (c) These Directions shall come into effect from April 1, 2024.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: 2 Applicability.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (a) These Directions shall be applicable to the following entities (collectively referred to as ‘regulated entities’ or ’REs’ in these directions):.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (i) all Banking Companies1, Corresponding New Banks and State Bank of India as defined under subsections (c), (da) and (nc) of section 5 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949 (collectively referred to as ‘commercial banks’ hereinafter).

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (ii) Non-Banking Financial Companies (hereinafter referred to as ‘NBFCs’) as defined under clause (f) of section 45I of the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 and included in the ‘Top Layer’, ‘Upper Layer’ and ‘Middle Layer’ defined in paragraphs 1.5, 1.4 and 1.3 respectively of the Annex to RBI circular DOR.CRE.REC.No.60/03.10.001/2021-22 dated October 22, 2021 on ‘Scale Based Regulation (SBR): A Revised Regulatory Framework for NBFCs’.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (iii) Credit Information Companies as defined under clause (e) of section 2 of the Credit Information Companies (Regulation) Act, 2005 (hereinafter referred to as ‘Credit Information Companies’ or ‘CICs’).

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (iv) EXIM Bank, National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (‘NABARD’), National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development (‘NaBFID’), National Housing Bank (‘NHB’) and Small Industries Development Bank of India (‘SIDBI’) as established by the Export-Import Bank of India Act, 1981; the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development Act, 1981; the National Bank For Financing Infrastructure and Development Act, 2021; National Housing Bank Act, 1987 and the Small Industries Development Bank of India Act, 1989 respectively (hereinafter referred to as ‘All India Financial Institutions’ or ‘AIFIs’).

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (b) These Directions shall not be applicable to:.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (i) Local Area Banks.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (ii) NBFC-Core Investment Companies.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (c) In the case of foreign banks operating in India through branch mode, reference to the board or board of directors in these Directions should be read as reference to the controlling office/ head office which has the oversight over the branch operations in India.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: Further, such foreign banks shall be subject to a ‘comply or explain’ approach in terms of the applicability of these Directions.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: The ‘comply or explain’ approach shall allow such foreign banks to deviate.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: from any specific part of these Directions subject to examination and acceptance by Reserve Bank of a reasonably justifiable explanation for the same, as part of the supervisory process.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: 3 Definitions.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (a) In these Directions, unless the context states otherwise, the terms herein shall bear the meanings assigned to them below:.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (i) ‘Cyber’ - Relating to, within, or through the medium of the interconnected information infrastructure of interactions among persons, processes, data, and information systems.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (ii) ‘Cyber event’ – Any observable occurrence in an information system.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: Cyber events sometimes provide indication that a cyber incident is occurring.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (iii) ‘Cyber security’ - Preservation of confidentiality, integrity and availability of information and/or information systems through the cyber medium.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: In addition, other properties, such as authenticity, accountability, non-repudiation and reliability can also be involved.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (iv) ‘Cyber incident’ shall mean a cyber event that adversely affects the cyber security of an information asset whether resulting from malicious activity or not.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (v) ‘Cyber-attack’ - Malicious attempt(s) to exploit vulnerabilities through the cyber medium to damage, disrupt or gain unauthorized access to assets.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (vi) ‘De-militarized Zone’ or ‘DMZ’ is a perimeter network segment that is logically between internal and external networks.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (vii) ‘Information Asset’ - Any piece of data, device or other component of the environment that supports information-related activities.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: Information Assets include information system, data, hardware and software.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (viii) ‘Information System’ - Set of applications, services, information technology assets or other information-handling components, which includes the operating environment and networks.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (ix) ‘IT Risk6’ - The business risk associated with the use, ownership, operation, involvement, influence and adoption of IT within an enterprise.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (x) ‘Privileged user7’ refers to user who, by virtue of function, and/or role, has been allocated powers within an information system, which are significantly greater than those available to the majority of users.

metadata.title: # Chapter I - Preliminary
# Chapter I - Preliminary

__data__.text: (b) All expressions unless defined herein shall have the same meaning as have been assigned to them under the Banking Regulation Act, 1949 or the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 or Credit Information Companies (Regulation) Act, 2005 or Information Technology Act, 2000 or Companies Act, 2013 and Rules made thereunder or any statutory modification or re-enactment thereto or as used in RBI Directions / Circulars, as the case may be.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: 4 IT Governance Framework.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (a) The key focus areas of IT Governance shall include strategic alignment, risk management, resource management, performance management and Business Continuity/ Disaster Recovery Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (b) REs shall put in place a robust IT Governance Framework based on the aforementioned focus areas that inter alia:.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (i) specifies the governance structure and processes necessary to meet the RE’s business/ strategic objectives;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (ii) specifies the roles (including authority) and responsibilities of the Board of Directors (Board) / Board level Committee and Senior Management; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iii) includes adequate oversight mechanisms to ensure accountability and mitigation of IT and cyber/ information security risks.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (c) Enterprise-wide risk management policy or operational risk management policy shall also incorporate periodic assessment of IT-related risks (both inherent and potential risk).

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: 5 Role of the Board of Directors.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (a) The strategies and policies related to IT, Information Assets, Business Continuity, Information Security, Cyber Security (including Incident Response and Recovery Management/ Cyber Crisis Management) shall be approved by the Board of Directors.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (b) Such strategies and policies shall be reviewed at least annually by the Board.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: 6 IT Strategy Committee of the Board.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (a) REs shall establish a Board-level IT Strategy Committee (ITSC)8.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (b) While constituting the ITSC, REs shall ensure:.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (i) Minimum of three directors as members;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (ii) The Chairperson of the ITSC shall be an independent director and have substantial IT expertise9 in managing/ guiding information technology initiatives; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iii) Members are technically competent10.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (c) The ITSC shall meet at least on a quarterly basis.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (d) The ITSC shall:.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (i) Ensure that the RE has put an effective IT strategic planning process in place;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (ii) Guide in preparation of IT Strategy and ensure that the IT Strategy aligns with the overall strategy of the RE towards accomplishment of its business objectives;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iii) Satisfy itself that the IT Governance and Information Security Governance structure fosters accountability, is effective and efficient, has adequate skilled resources, well defined objectives and unambiguous responsibilities for each level in the organisation;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iv) Ensure that the RE has put in place processes for assessing and managing IT and cybersecurity risks;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (v) Ensure that the budgetary allocations for the IT function (including for IT security), cyber security are commensurate with the RE’s IT maturity, digital depth, threat environment and industry standards and are utilised in a manner intended for meeting the stated objectives; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (vi) Review, at least on annual basis, the adequacy and effectiveness of the Business Continuity Planning and Disaster Recovery Management of the RE.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: 7 Senior Management and IT Steering Committee.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (a) The Senior Management of the RE shall, inter alia, ensure:.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (i) Execution of the IT Strategy approved by the Board;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (ii) IT/ IS and their support infrastructure are functioning effectively and efficiently;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iii) Necessary IT risk management processes are in place and create a culture of IT risk awareness and cyber hygiene practices in the RE;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iv) Cyber security posture of the RE is robust; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (v) Overall, IT contributes to productivity, effectiveness and efficiency in business operations.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (b) REs shall establish an IT Steering Committee with representation at Senior Management level from IT and business functions.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (c) The responsibilities of IT Steering Committee, inter alia, shall be to:.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (i) Assist the ITSC in strategic IT planning, oversight of IT performance, and aligning IT activities with business needs;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (ii) Oversee the processes put in place for business continuity and disaster recovery;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iii) Ensure implementation of a robust IT architecture meeting statutory and regulatory compliance; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iv) Update ITSC and CEO periodically on the activities of IT Steering Committee.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (d) The IT Steering Committee shall meet at least on a quarterly basis.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: 8 Head of IT Function.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (a) REs shall appoint a sufficiently senior level, technically competent and experienced official in IT related aspects as Head of IT Function.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (b) The Head of IT Function shall, inter alia, be responsible for the following:.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (i) Ensuring that the execution of IT projects/ initiatives is aligned with the RE’s IT Policy and IT Strategy;.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (ii) Ensuring that there is an effective organisational structure to support IT functions in the RE; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (iii) Putting in place an effective disaster recovery setup and business continuity strategy/ plan.

metadata.title: # Chapter II - IT Governance
# Chapter II - IT Governance

__data__.text: (c) As a first line of defence, the Head of IT Function shall ensure effective assessment, evaluation and management of IT controls and IT risk, including the implementation of robust internal controls, to (i) secure the RE’s information assets (ii) comply with extant internal policies, regulatory and legal requirements on IT related aspects.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 9 IT Services Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) REs shall put in place a robust IT Service Management Framework for supporting their information systems and infrastructure to ensure the operational resilience of their entire IT environment (including DR sites).

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) A Service Level Management (SLM) process shall be put in place to manage the IT operations while ensuring effective segregation of duties.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) REs shall ensure identification and mapping of the security classification (in terms of Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability) of information assets based on their criticality to the REs’ operations.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (d) For seamless continuity of business operations, REs shall avoid using outdated and unsupported hardware or software and shall monitor software’s end-of-support (EOS) date and Annual Maintenance Contract (AMC) dates of IT hardware on an ongoing basis.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (e) REs shall develop a technology refresh plan for the replacement of hardware and software in a timely manner before they reach EOS.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 10 Third-Party Arrangements.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: Where third-party arrangements in the Information Technology/ Cyber Security ecosystem are not within the applicability of the Reserve Bank of India (Outsourcing of Information Technology Services) Directions, 2023, REs shall, put in place appropriate vendor risk assessment process and controls proportionate to the assessed risk and materiality to, inter alia:.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) mitigate concentration risk;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) eliminate or address any conflict of interests;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) mitigate risks associated with single point of failure;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (d) comply with applicable legal, regulatory requirements and standards to protect customer data;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (e) provide high availability (for uninterrupted customer service); and.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (f) manage supply chain risks effectively.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 11 Capacity Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) REs shall ensure that information systems and infrastructure are able to support business functions and ensure availability of all service delivery channels.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) On an annual or more frequent basis, REs shall proactively assess capacity requirement of IT resources.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: REs shall ensure that IT capacity planning across components, services, system resources, supporting infrastructure is consistent with past trends (peak usage), the current business requirements and projected future needs as per the IT strategy of the RE.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) The assessment of IT capacity requirements and measures taken to address the issues shall be reviewed by the ITSC.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 12 Project Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) REs shall follow a consistent and formally defined project management approach for IT projects undertaken by them.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: The project management approach shall, inter alia, enable appropriate stakeholder participation for effective monitoring and management of project risks and progress.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) While adopting new or emerging technologies, tools, or revamping their existing ones in the technology stack, REs shall follow a standard enterprise architecture planning methodology or framework.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) Adoption of new or emerging technologies shall be commensurate with the risk appetite and align with overall Business/ IT strategy of the RE.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: It should facilitate optimal creation, use, or sharing of information by a business in a secure and resilient way.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (d) REs shall maintain enterprise data dictionary to enable the sharing of data among applications and information systems and promote a common understanding of data.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (e) REs shall ensure that maintenance and necessary support of software applications is provided by the software vendors and the same is enforced through formal agreement.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (f) REs shall obtain the source codes for all critical applications from their vendors.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: Where obtaining of the source code is not possible, REs shall put in place a source code escrow arrangement or other arrangements to adequately mitigate the risk of default by the vendor.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: REs shall ensure that all product updates and programme fixes are included in the source code escrow arrangement.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (g) REs shall obtain a certificate or a written confirmation from the application developer or vendor stating that the application is free of known vulnerabilities, malware, and any covert channels in the code.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: Such a certificate or a written confirmation shall also be obtained whenever material changes to the code, including upgrades, occur.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (h) Any new IT application proposed to be introduced as a business product13 shall be subjected to product approval and quality assurance process.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 13 Change and Patch Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: REs shall put in place documented policy(ies) and procedures for change and patch management to ensure the following:.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) the business impact of implementing patches/ changes (or not implementing a particular patch/ change request) are assessed;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) the patches/ changes are applied/ implemented and reviewed in a secure and timely manner with necessary approvals;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) any changes to an application system or data are justified by genuine business needs and approvals supported by documentation and subjected to a robust change management process; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (d) mechanism is established to recover from failed changes/ patch deployment or unexpected results.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 14 Data Migration Controls.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: REs shall have a documented data migration policy specifying a systematic process for data migration, ensuring data integrity, completeness and consistency.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: The policy shall, inter alia, contain provisions pertaining to signoffs from business users and application owners at each stage of migration, maintenance of audit trails, etc.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: IT Applications that enable functioning of a business process whether offered as a product to the customers (including potential customers), third parties (or) internal employees could be broadly referred as business product.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 15 Audit Trails.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) Every IT application which can access or affect critical or sensitive information, shall have necessary audit and system logging capability and should provide audit trails.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) The audit trails shall satisfy a RE’s business requirements apart from regulatory and legal requirements.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: The audit trails must be detailed enough to facilitate the conduct of audit, serve as forensic evidence when required and assist in dispute resolution, including for non-repudiation purposes.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) REs shall put in place a system for regularly monitoring the audit trails and system logs to detect any unauthorised activity.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 16 Cryptographic controls.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: The key length, algorithms, cipher suites and applicable protocols used in transmission channels, processing of data and authentication purpose shall be strong.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: REs shall adopt internationally accepted and published standards that are not deprecated/demonstrated to be insecure/vulnerable and the configurations involved in implementing such controls shall be compliant with extant laws and regulatory instructions.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 17 Straight Through Processing.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) In order to prevent unauthorised modification of data, REs shall ensure that there is no manual intervention or manual modification in data while it is being transferred from one process to another or from one application to another, in respect of critical applications.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) Data transfer mechanism between processes or applications must be properly tested, securely automated with necessary checks and balances, and properly integrated through “Straight Through Processing” methodology with appropriate authentication mechanism and audit trails.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 18 Physical and Environmental Controls.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) REs shall implement suitable physical and environmental controls in Data Centre and Disaster Recovery sites used by them.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) The DC and DR sites should be geographically well separated so that both the sites are not affected by a similar threat associated to their location.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) REs shall ensure that their DC and DR sites are subjected to necessary e-surveillance mechanism.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 19 Access Controls.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) Access to information assets shall be allowed only where a valid business need exists.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: REs shall have documented standards and procedures, which are approved by the ITSC and kept up to date for administering need-based access to an information system.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) Personnel with elevated system access entitlements shall be closely supervised with all their systems activities logged and periodically reviewed.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) REs shall adopt multi-factor authentication for privileged users of i) critical information systems and ii) for critical activities, basis the RE’s risk assessment.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 20 Controls on Teleworking.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: In the teleworking environment, REs, inter alia, shall:.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) Ensure that the systems used and the remote access from alternate work location to the environment hosting RE’s information assets are secure;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) Implement multi-factor authentication for enterprise access (logical) to critical systems;.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) Put in place a mechanism to identify all remote-access devices attached/ connected to the RE’s systems; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (d) Ensure that data/ information shared/ presented in teleworking is secured appropriately.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: 21 Metrics.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (a) REs shall define suitable metrics for system performance, recovery and business resumption, including Recovery Point Objective (RPO) and Recovery Time Objective (RTO), for all critical information systems.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (b) For non-critical information systems, REs shall adopt a risk-based approach to define suitable metrics.

metadata.title: # Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management
# Chapter III - IT Infrastructure & Services Management

__data__.text: (c) REs shall implement suitable scorecard/ metrics/ methodology to measure IT performance and IT maturity level.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: 22 Periodic review of IT related risks.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: The risk management policy of the RE shall include IT related risks, including the Cyber Security related risks, and the Risk Management Committee of the Board (RMCB) in consultation with the ITSC shall periodically review and update the same at least on a yearly basis.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: 23 IT and Information Security Risk Management Framework.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: REs shall establish a robust IT and Information Security Risk Management Framework covering, inter alia, the following aspects:.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (a) Implementation of comprehensive Information Security management function, internal controls and processes (including applicable insurance covers) to mitigate/ manage identified risks.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: The implemented controls and processes must be reviewed periodically on their efficacy in a risk environment characterised by change;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (b) Definition of roles and responsibilities of stakeholders (including third-party personnel) involved in IT risk management.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: Areas of possible role conflicts and accountability gaps must be specifically identified and eliminated or managed;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (c) Identification of critical information systems of the organisation and fortification of the security environment of such systems;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: REs may have flexibility to define Information / Cyber security risk management framework distinct from IT risk management framework.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (d) Definition and implementation of necessary systems, procedures and controls to ensure secure storage/ transmission/ processing of data/ information.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: 24 Information Security Policy and Cyber Security Policy.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (a) The Information Security Policy shall take into consideration, inter alia, aspects such as the objectives, scope, ownership and responsibility for the Policy; information security organisational structure; exceptions; compliance review and penal measures for non-compliance of Policies.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: REs shall also put in place a Cyber Security Policy and Cyber Crisis Management Plan (CCMP).

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (b) An Information Security Committee (ISC), under the oversight of the ITSC, shall be formed for managing cyber/ information security.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: The constitution of the ISC, with Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and other representatives from business and IT functions, etc., shall be decided by the ITSC.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: The head of the ISC shall be from risk management vertical.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: Major responsibilities of the ISC, inter alia, shall include:.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (i) Development of information/ cyber security policies, implementation of policies, standards and procedures to ensure that all identified risks are managed within the RE’s risk appetite;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (ii) Approving and monitoring information security projects and security awareness initiatives;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (iii) Reviewing cyber incidents, information systems audit observations, monitoring and mitigation activities; and.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (iv) Updating ITSC and CEO periodically on the activities of ISC.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (c) A senior level executive (preferably in the rank of a General Manager or an equivalent position) shall be designated as the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO).

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: The CISO shall not have any direct reporting relationship with the Head of IT Function and shall not be given any business targets.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: REs shall ensure the following:.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (i) The CISO has the requisite technical background and expertise;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (ii) She/He is appointed for a reasonable minimum term;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (iii) The CISO’s Office is adequately staffed with people having necessary technical expertise, commensurate with the business volume, extent of technology adoption and complexity;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (iv) The budget for the information/ cyber security is determined keeping in view the current/ emerging threat landscape.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (d) REs shall ensure that the roles and responsibilities of the CISO are clearly defined and documented covering, at a minimum, the following points:.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (i) The CISO shall be responsible for driving cyber security strategy and ensuring compliance to the extant regulatory/ statutory instructions on information/ cyber security.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (ii) The CISO shall be responsible for enforcing the policies that a RE uses to protect its information assets apart from coordinating information/ cyber security related issues within the RE as well as with relevant external agencies.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (iii) The CISO shall be a permanent invitee to the ITSC and IT Steering Committee.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (iv) The CISO’s Office shall manage and monitor Security Operations Centre (SOC) and drive cyber security related projects.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (v) The CISO’s office shall ensure effective functioning of the security solutions deployed.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (vi) The CISO shall directly report to the Executive Director or equivalent executive overseeing the risk management function;.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (vii) CISO shall place a review of cyber security risks/ arrangements/ preparedness of the RE before the Board/ RMCB/ ITSC at least on a quarterly basis.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: 25 Risk Assessment.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (a) The risk assessment for each information asset within the RE’s scope shall be guided by appropriate security standards/ IT control frameworks.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (b) REs shall ensure that all staff members and service providers comply with the extant information security and acceptable-use policies as applicable to them.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (c) REs shall review their security infrastructure and security policies at least annually, factoring in their own experiences and emerging threats and risks.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: REs shall take steps to adequately tackle cyber-attacks including phishing, spoofing attacks and mitigate their adverse effects.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: 26 Conduct of Vulnerability Assessment (VA) / Penetration Testing (PT).

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (a) For critical information systems and/or those in the De-Militarized Zone (DMZ) having customer interface, VA shall be conducted at least once in every six months and PT at least once in 12 months.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: Also, REs shall conduct VA/PT of such information systems throughout their lifecycle (pre-implementation, post implementation, after major changes, etc.).

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (b) For non-critical information systems, a risk-based approach shall be adopted to decide the requirement and periodicity of conduct of VA/PT.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (c) VA/PT shall be conducted by appropriately trained and independent information security experts/auditors.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (d) In the post implementation (of IT project/system upgrade, etc.)

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: scenario, the VA/PT shall be performed on the production environment.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: Under unavoidable circumstances, if the PT is conducted in test environment, REs shall ensure that the version and configuration of the test environment resembles the production environment.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: Any deviation should be documented and approved by the ISC.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (e) REs shall ensure to fix the identified vulnerabilities and associated risks in a time-bound manner by undertaking requisite corrective measures and ensure that the compliance is sustained to avoid recurrence of known vulnerabilities such as those available in Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) database.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (f) REs shall put in place a documented approach for conduct of VA/PT covering the scope, coverage, vulnerability scoring mechanism (e.g., Common Vulnerability Scoring System) and all other aspects.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: This may also apply to the RE’s information systems hosted in a cloud environment.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: 27 Cyber Incident Response and Recovery Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: (a) The cyber incident response and recovery management policy shall address the classification and assessment of incidents; include a clear communication strategy and plan to manage such incidents, contain exposures and achieve timely recovery.

metadata.title: # Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management
# Chapter IV - IT and Information Security Risk Management

__data__.text: - The term ‘incident’ implies ‘cyber incident’ in this Master Direction

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: 28 Business Continuity Plan (BCP) and Disaster Recovery (DR) Policy.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (a) The BCP and DR policy shall adopt best practices to guide its actions in reducing the likelihood or impact of the disruptive incidents and maintaining business continuity.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: The policy shall be updated based on major developments/risk assessment.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (b) RE’s BCP/ DR capabilities shall be designed to effectively support its resilience objectives and enable it to rapidly recover and securely resume its critical operations (including security controls) post cyber-attacks/ other incidents.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: 29 Disaster Recovery Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (a) Periodicity of DR drills for critical information systems shall be at least on a half-yearly basis and for other information systems, as per RE’s risk assessment.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (b) Any major issues observed during the DR drill shall be resolved and tested again to ensure successful conduct of drill before the next cycle.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (c) The DR testing shall involve switching over to the DR / alternate site and thus using it as the primary site for sufficiently long period where usual business operations of at least a full working day (including Beginning of Day to End of Day operations) are covered.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (d) REs shall regularly test the BCP / DR under different scenarios for possible types of contingencies, to ensure that it is up-to-date and effective.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (e) REs shall backup data and periodically restore such backed-up data to check its usability.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: The integrity of such backup data shall be preserved along with securing it from unauthorised access.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (f) REs shall ensure that DR architecture and procedures are robust, meeting the defined RTO and RPO for any recovery operations in case of contingency.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (g) REs should prioritise achieving minimal RTO (as approved by the RE’s ITSC) and a near zero RPO for critical information systems.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (h) In a scenario of non-zero RPO, REs shall have a documented methodology for reconciliation of data while resuming operations from the alternate location.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (i) REs shall ensure that the configurations of information systems and deployed security patches at the DC and DR are identical.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: (j) REs shall ensure BCP and DR capabilities in critical interconnected systems and networks including those of vendors and partners.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: REs shall ensure demonstrated readiness through collaborative and co-ordinated resilience testing that meets the REs’ RTO.

metadata.title: # Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management
# Chapter V - Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Management

__data__.text: DC refers to primary data centre for a given application/ system and DR its Disaster Recovery site/ alternate site.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: 30 Information Systems (IS) Audit.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: (a) The Audit Committee of the Board (ACB) shall be responsible for exercising oversight of IS Audit of the RE.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: (b) REs shall put in place an IS Audit Policy.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: The IS Audit Policy shall contain a clear description of its mandate, purpose, authority, audit universe, periodicity of audit etc.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: The policy shall be approved by the ACB and reviewed at least annually.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: (c) The ACB shall review critical issues highlighted related to IT / information security / cyber security and provide appropriate direction and guidance to the RE’s Management.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: (d) REs shall have a separate IS Audit function or resources who possess required professional skills and competence within the Internal Audit function.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: Where the RE uses external resources for conducting IS audit in areas where skills are lacking within the RE, the responsibility and accountability for such external IS audits would continue to remain with the competent authority within Internal Audit function.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: (e) REs shall carry out IS Audit planning by adopting a risk-based audit approach.

metadata.title: # Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit
# Chapter VI - Information Systems (IS) Audit

__data__.text: (f) REs may consider, wherever possible, a continuous auditing approach for critical systems, performing control and risk assessments on a more frequent basis.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: With the issue of these Directions, the instructions/ guidelines contained in the circulars issued by the Reserve Bank of India listed in Annex shall stand repealed from the dates mentioned in the said Annex.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: All the instructions/ guidelines given in the circulars referred above shall be deemed as given under these Directions.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: Any reference in other circulars/ guidelines/ notifications issued by the Reserve Bank containing reference to the said repealed circulars, shall mean the reference to these Directions, namely, the Reserve Bank of India (Information Technology Governance, Risk, Controls and Assurance Practices) Directions, 2023, after the date of repeal.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: Notwithstanding such repeal, any action taken, purported to have been taken or.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: 31 Application of other laws not barred.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: The provisions of these Directions shall be in addition to, and not in derogation of the provisions of any other laws, rules, regulations or directions, for the time being in force.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: 32 Interpretation.

metadata.title: # Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions
# Chapter VII – Repeal and Other Provisions

__data__.text: For the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of these Directions or in order to remove any difficulties in the application or interpretation of the provisions of these Directions, the Reserve Bank of India may, if it considers necessary, issue necessary clarifications in respect of any matter covered herein and the interpretation of any provision of these Directions given by the Reserve Bank of India shall be final and binding.
